dt: {bc}marked by or disposed to doing good
{bc}organized for the purpose of doing good

quotes.t: A Southern writer is allowed his eccentricities. The prevailing attitude is a kind of {qword}benevolent{/qword} neglect.
Grandfather sometimes turned on us like a rigged trap, and of course the {qword}benevolent{/qword} gaze of the sage became the glare of the patriarch.
Trees that size are like whales, sort of {qword}benevolent{/qword} in their huge bulk …

They tore out the windows of the club's simple storefront and bricked them over and left two much smaller windows … so that the look of the club changed from that of a {qword}benevolent{/qword} neighborhood organization to that of a paramilitary one.

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}benevolent-, benevolens{/it}, from {it}bene{/it} + {it}volent-, volens{/it}, present participle of {it}velle{/it} to wish {ma}{mat|will|}{/ma}
shortdef: marked by or disposed to doing good
organized for the purpose of doing good
marked by or suggestive of goodwill
